 <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎קַב‎</span> **noun [masculine]** ==kab== (Late Hebrew ***id.***; Syriac <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">; Talmud <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎קַבָא‎</span>); — a measure of capacity, Biblical Hebrew only dry measure, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎רֹבַע הַקַּב‎</span> [[2Kgs.6.25|2Kgs 6:25]] 1/4 ***kab***; on size of <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎קַב‎</span> = 4 <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לֹג‎</span> = 1/6 <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎סְאָה‎</span> = 1/6 <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הִין‎</span> = approximately 2 litres see [[BDB#Now|Now]]<sup>Archaeology i. 202 f.</sup> [[BDB#Benz|Benz]]<sup>Archaeology 182</sup>.
